text: Heat a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat on a gas stove.  Add 2 tablespoon of oil into it.  add all spices save asafetida and red chilly  Sauté them for few minutes till they exude aroma.  Add and stir in each ingredient one by one.  Mix all the ingredients thoroughly in the pan while on the heat  Now add asfoetida and red chilly and the moment smoke or smoky smell is felt add urad daal  Mix thoroughly and cook till they all start leaving the pan in single piece else add some more oil and  cook again  Remove the frying pan from the gas stove to cool. Let the spices cool for some time. After cooled, knead all the contents and form a dough. Do not add water. Place the lid over the frying pan and allow the mixture to rise and fluff -- 5 to 6 hours or more.  Take small amount of dough in your palm. Give it a shape of a patty. Make a hole in the middle of the patty or the cake so that it can dry (or it may be too moist in the middle).  Place the patty or the cake in a greased large plate or a tray. Make as many patties or cakes possible with the remaining dough. Keep the plate or the tray in the sun for 4 to 5 days. Place the cakes in a jar or a container for future purposes (such as grinding up to use as spice).
sentences: Heat a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat on a gas stove.
Add 2 tablespoon of oil into it.
add all spices save asafetida and red chilly  Sauté them for few minutes till they exude aroma.
Add and stir in each ingredient one by one.

Mix all the ingredients thoroughly in the pan while on the heat  Now add asfoetida and red chilly and the moment smoke or smoky smell is felt add urad daal  Mix thoroughly and cook till they all start leaving the pan in single piece else add some more oil and  cook again  Remove the frying pan from the gas stove to cool.
Let the spices cool for some time.
After cooled, knead all the contents and form a dough.
Place the lid over the frying pan and allow the mixture to rise and fluff -- 5 to 6 hours or more.
Take small amount of dough in your palm.
Give it a shape of a patty.
Make a hole in the middle of the patty or the cake so that it can dry (or it may be too moist in the middle).
Place the patty or the cake in a greased large plate or a tray.
Make as many patties or cakes possible with the remaining dough.
Keep the plate or the tray in the sun for 4 to 5 days.
Place the cakes in a jar or a container for future purposes (such as grinding up to use as spice).
